Package io.dimeformat.crypto

Class Crypto

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.dimeformat.crypto.Crypto
  • public final class Crypto
extends java.lang.Object
    Cryptographic helper methods, which also abstracts the rest of the implementation from any underlying cryptographic library used.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Crypto()
      Default constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Crypto

        public Crypto()
        Default constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • setDefaultSuiteName

        public void setDefaultSuiteName​(java.lang.String name)
        Set the default cryptographic suite name. This will be used when no suite is specified for cryptographic operations. It can be queried through getDefaultSuiteName(). This will be set by default to Dime Standard Cryptographic Suite (STN).
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the suite to set as the default.

      • getDefaultSuiteName

        public java.lang.String getDefaultSuiteName()
        Returns the name of the cryptographic suite that is set as the default.
        Returns:
        Name of default cryptographic suite.

      • generateKeyName

        public java.lang.String generateKeyName​(Key key)
        Will generate a unique key name from the provided key. This will be used to extract which key was used to create a signature. How a key name is generated is specific to the cryptographic suite used.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to generate a name for.
        Returns:
        A key name, as a String.

      • generateSignature

        public Signature generateSignature​(Item item,
                                   Key key)
                            throws CryptographyException
        Generates a cryptographic signature from a provided item and key.
        Parameters:
        item - The item that should be signed.
        key - The key that should be used to sign the item.
        Returns:
        The signature that was generated.
        Throws:
        CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

      • verifySignature

        public boolean verifySignature​(Item item,
                               Signature signature,
                               Key key)
                        throws CryptographyException
        Verifies a cryptographic signature of an item using provided signature and key.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to verify the signature with.
        signature - The signature to verify with.
        key - The key to use when verifying.
        Returns:
        True if verified successfully, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

      • generateKey

        public Key generateKey​(java.util.List<KeyCapability> capabilities)
                throws CryptographyException
        Generates a cryptographic key of a provided type. This will use the cryptographic suite that is set as the default.
        Parameters:
        capabilities - The capabilities of the key to generate.
        Returns:
        The generated key.
        Throws:
        CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

      • generateKey

        public Key generateKey​(java.util.List<KeyCapability> capabilities,
                       java.lang.String suiteName)
                throws CryptographyException
        Generates a cryptographic key of a provided type.
        Parameters:
        capabilities - The capabilities of the key to generate.
        suiteName - The cryptographic suite that should be used when generating the key.
        Returns:
        The generated key.
        Throws:
        CryptographyException - If anything goes wrong.

      • generateSharedSecret

        public Key generateSharedSecret​(Key clientKey,
                                Key serverKey,
                                java.util.List<KeyCapability> capabilities)
                         throws CryptographyException
        Generates a shared secret from two keys with use 'Exchange'. The initiator of the key exchange is always the server and the receiver of the key exchange is always the client (no matter on which side this method is called).
        Parameters:
        clientKey - The client key to use (the receiver of the exchange).
        serverKey - The server key to use (the initiator of the exchange).
        capabilities - The capabilities that should be specified for the generated key.
        Returns:
        The generated shared secret key.
        Throws:
        CryptographyException - If anything goes wrong.

      • encrypt

        public byte[] encrypt​(byte[] plainText,
                      Key key)
               throws CryptographyException
        Encrypts a plain text byte array using the provided key.
        Parameters:
        plainText - The byte array to encrypt.
        key - The key to use for the encryption.
        Returns:
        The encrypted cipher text.
        Throws:
        CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

      • decrypt

        public byte[] decrypt​(byte[] cipherText,
                      Key key)
               throws CryptographyException
        Decrypts a cipher text byte array using the provided key.
        Parameters:
        cipherText - The byte array to decrypt.
        key - The key to use for the decryption.
        Returns:
        The decrypted plain text.
        Throws:
        CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

      • generateHash

        public java.lang.String generateHash​(byte[] data)
                              throws CryptographyException
        Generates a secure hash of a byte array. This will use the cryptographic suite that is set as the default.
        Parameters:
        data - The data that should be hashed.
        Returns:
        The generated secure hash, encoded as a string
        Throws:
        CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

      • generateHash

        public java.lang.String generateHash​(byte[] data,
                                     java.lang.String suiteName)
                              throws CryptographyException
        Generates a secure hash of a byte array.
        Parameters:
        data - The data that should be hashed.
        suiteName - The cryptographic suite that should be used to generate the hash.
        Returns:
        The generated secure hash, encoded as a string
        Throws:
        CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

      • encodeKeyBytes

        public java.lang.String encodeKeyBytes​(byte[] rawKey,
                                       Claim claim,
                                       java.lang.String suiteName)
        Encodes a key from a byte array to a string. The encoding format is determined by the cryptographic suite specified.
        Parameters:
        rawKey - The raw key bytes to encode.
        claim - The name of the claim to encode the key for, must be Claim.KEY or Claim.PUB.
        suiteName - The cryptographic suite to use.
        Returns:
        The encoded key.

      • decodeKeyBytes

        public byte[] decodeKeyBytes​(java.lang.String encodedKey,
                             Claim claim,
                             java.lang.String suiteName)
        Decodes an encoded key to a byte array. The encoded format must match the cryptographic suite specified to be successful.
        Parameters:
        encodedKey - The encoded raw key bytes.
        claim - The name of the claim to decode the key for, should be Claim.KEY or Claim.PUB
        suiteName - The cryptographic suite to use.
        Returns:
        The decoded key.

      • registerCryptoSuite

        public void registerCryptoSuite​(ICryptoSuite impl)
        Registers a cryptographic suite. If a cryptographic suite is already register with the same name as the provided cryptographic suite then IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        impl - The implementation instance of ICryptoSuite.

      • hasCryptoSuite

        public boolean hasCryptoSuite​(java.lang.String name)
        Indicates if a cryptographic suite with the provided name is supported (and registered).
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the cryptographic suite to check for.
        Returns:
        True if supported, false if not.

      • allCryptoSuites

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> allCryptoSuites()
        Returns a set of the names of all registered cryptographic suites.
        Returns:
        Set of registered cryptographic suites, names only.
